title: The Mutants
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor on 30th-century Earth: 'Grey cities linked by grey highways across a grey desert. Slag, ash and clinker, the fruits of technology.'
dialogue_disasters: The Doctor's silly speech about an antimatter explosion turning them into 'un-people, un-doing un-things un-together.'
goofs: Jon Pertwee in episode one: 'I'm not allowed to open it. I couldn't even if I wanted to. No, I'm not meant to. I couldn't open it even if I wanted to.'
The opening, with a hermit-like figure shambling towards the camera, is screaming out for an 'It's…'
When using oxymasks, the Overlords' dialogue is frequently unintelligible.

The end of episode four is ludicrous: Varan, shot by the Marshal, falls against the hull of Skybase which disintegrates, sucking him into space (he doesn't explode in the vacuum). Despite the gaping hole, Jo, Cotton, Stubbs and Ky are able to walk away from the area once the pressure has 'normalised'.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, currently in his third incarnation
continuity_notes.current_status: Working as a 'messenger boy' for the CIA, able to withstand considerable radiation and toxic atmospheres

continuity_notes.name: Thaesium
continuity_notes.description: A rich fuel mineral mined on Solos

continuity_notes.name: Solonians
continuity_notes.description: Indigenous species of Solos, undergoing metamorphic changes
continuity_notes.current_status: Oppressed by Earth colonists, experiencing cyclical mutations

technobabble: The Doctor plans to install a minimum-inertia hyperdrive for Bessie (see 'The Time Monster').
roots: References to the book of Genesis
Gibbon's Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire
An allegory concerning South African racism and British colonialism in general
links: 'The Brain of Morbius' (mentions Solos being in the Nebula of Cyclops)

locations.name: Solos
locations.description: Earth colony in the 30th century, located in the Nebula of Cyclops
locations.current_status: Under Earth colonial rule for 500 years, experiencing 500-year 'seasons' that affect Solonian biology

locations.name: Earth
locations.description: Home planet of humans, future state
locations.current_status: Exhausted politically, economically, and biologically in the 30th century

future_history: After Earth 'sacked the solar system they moved on to pastures new'. Earth is described as exhausted 'politically, economically and biologically' in the 30th century. Solos has been colonized for 500 years, with Earth running an apartheid policy.
additional_notes: The story is mentioned in Salman Rushdie's novel 'The Satanic Verses'.
bottom_line: 'Genocide as a side effect.' The episode is described as tedious, with poor special effects (CSO) and acting. Geoffrey Palmer's performance is noted as the best part, despite his character dying in the first episode.
